alert.note: Alert for Grand and Battlement Mesas; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide; Western Mosquito Range, East Lake County Above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 13 at 4:51PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. ...AVALANCHE WARNING IN EFFECT 5 PM SATURDAY UNTIL 5 PM MONDAY... * WHAT...The Avalanche Danger is HIGH (Level 4 of 5) on Sunday and Monday. * WHERE...The Park Range, Flat Top Mountains, Medicine Bow Mountains, Never Summer Mountains, Front Range, Gore Range, Elk Mountains, Ruby Range, Mosquito Range, Sawatch Range, Grand Mesa, northwest San Juan Mountains * WHEN...In effect from 5 PM Saturday, January 13 until 5 PM Monday, January 15. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow and strong winds have created very dangerous avalanche conditions. Large and dangerous avalanches will be very easy to trigger. Avalanches will run naturally. * PRECAUTION/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Travel in backcountry avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avoid travel on and under slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. You can find more detailed information at colorado.gov/avalanche
